The_Lacs:
{{short description|American hip hop group}} {{Use American English|date=January 2023}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2023}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The LACs | origin = [[Baxley, Georgia]], United States | genre = [[Country rap]] | years_active = 2002–present | label = {{hlist|Side Ya Mouth|[[Average Joes Entertainment|Backroad Records]]|Dirt Rock Empire}} | current_members = Brian Andrew "Rooster" King
Robert Clayton "Uncle Snap" Sharpe{{cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#/ace/search/workID/898010045 |title=DEAD MAN WALKING |website=ASCAP |publisher=American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers |access-date=April 27, 2023}}
| past_members = Dennis Morgan }} '''The Lacs''' is an American [[country rap]] duo that consists of Robert Clayton (Clay) "Uncle Snap" Sharpe and Brian Andrew "Rooster" King.{{Cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-615/5679824/the-lacs-score-career-best-rank-on-top-country-albums|title=The Lacs' Score Career-Best Rank On Top Country Albums|magazine=Billboard|access-date=May 3, 2016}} At first, the group also featured Brandon Herndon on the three self-released albums on Side Ya Mouth Records.{{Cite web|url=http://www.showcaseyourmusic.com/LACS|title=SYM – LACS|website=Showcase Your Music|access-date=May 3, 2016}} The Lacs have recorded six albums for Backroad Records, a subsidiary of [[Average Joes Entertainment]], an independent label co-owned by fellow country rap artist [[Colt Ford]]. Four albums have entered the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]: ''Keep it Redneck'' (2013), ''Outlaw in Me'' and ''American Rebelution'' (2017). The Lacs created their own record label ''Dirt Rock Empire''{{cite web |url=http://www.dirtrockempire.com/ |title=DirtRockEmpire.com |work=DirRockEmpire }} in 2017. On September 22, 2017, The Lacs released the first album from Dirt Rock titled ''Dirtbagz, Vol. 1'' which is a compilation album featuring many of the labels artists such as Nate Kenyon, Crucifix and Hard Target. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Album details ! colspan="5"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:9em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
